info.author: Hyeonki Hong
info.description:
# Lot.GPIO

## Installation

```bash
sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:loliot/ppa &&\
sudo apt install lot
```

```bash
sudo lot install
```

```bash
sudo apt update &&\
sudo apt install -y swig python3 python3-dev python3-pip &&\
python3 -m pip install -U --user pip setuptools
```

```bash
python3 -m pip install --user Lot.GPIO
```

## Blink example

```bash
import Lot.GPIO as GPIO
# You can also use 'import RPi.GPIO as GPIO'.

import time

LED_PIN = [11, 13, 15]

GPIO.setup(LED_PIN, GPIO.OUT)

while True:
    GPIO.output(LED_PIN, GPIO.HIGH)
    time.sleep(0.3)
    GPIO.output(LED_PIN, GPIO.LOW)
    time.sleep(0.3)
```

## Changelog

Ref: debian/changelog

Lot.GPIO (0.1.0) unstable; urgency=medium

  * Refactor setmode()/output()

 -- Hyeonki Hong <hhk7734@gmail.com>  Sat, 18 Jan 2020 15:13:13 +0900

Lot.GPIO (0.0.2) unstable; urgency=medium

    * Implement RPi.GPIO API.

 -- Hyeonki Hong <hhk7734@gmail.com>  Sun, 06 Oct 2019 21:46:57 +0900

Lot.GPIO (0.0.1) unstable; urgency=medium

    * Initial release.

 -- Hyeonki Hong <hhk7734@gmail.com>  Thu, 22 Aug 2019 22:41:00 +0900

info.summary: A module to control SBC GPIO
